docs.snippet: The Senate Judiciary Committee is asking for new records from two current and former White House officials as part of its investigation into Russian meddling in the 2016 election.

headline.print_headline: Senate Judiciary Panel Requests New Info on Trump Officials
headline.main: Senate Judiciary Panel Requests New Info on Trump Officials

docs.snippet: Congressional Democrats raised ethics questions on Monday about the framework of a defense fund set up to help pay legal costs for White House, Trump campaign and transition officials caught up in investigations into Russian meddling in the electi...

headline.print_headline: Democrats Raise Ethics Questions About Trump Defense Fund
headline.main: Democrats Raise Ethics Questions About Trump Defense Fund

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump won't let up on Amazon. He's been assailing the online retailer for days, zeroing in on a "scam" contract with the U.S. Postal Service that's actually been judged profitable for the post office.

headline.print_headline: AP FACT CHECK: Trump Assails Mexico, Amazon, Twisting Facts
headline.main: AP FACT CHECK: Trump Assails Mexico, Amazon, Twisting Facts

docs.snippet: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said on Friday he would explain Japan's stance on the North Korean abduction of Japanese citizens in a meeting with Donald Trump, ahead of the U.S. president's planned summit with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un.

headline.print_headline: Japan PM to Raise North Korean Abductions in Trump Summit
headline.main: Japan PM to Raise North Korean Abductions in Trump Summit

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump ousted Veterans Affairs Secretary David Shulkin on Wednesday in response to heavy criticism and nominated his personal physician, Rear Admiral Ronny Jackson, to replace him in the latest turnover among Trump's team.

headline.print_headline: Trump Pushes Out Shulkin at VA, Nominates Jackson as Replacement
headline.main: Trump Pushes Out Shulkin at VA, Nominates Jackson as Replacement

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump's unscripted remark this week about pulling out of Syria "very soon," while at odds with his own policy, was not a one-off: For weeks, top advisers have been fretting about an overly hasty withdrawal as the president has inc...

headline.print_headline: In Private, Trump Has Mused About Syria Pullout for Weeks
headline.main: In Private, Trump Has Mused About Syria Pullout for Weeks

docs.snippet: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday froze more than $200 million in funds for recovery efforts in Syria as his administration reassesses Washington's role in the long-drawn conflict there, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing officials.

headline.print_headline: Trump Freezes Funds for Syria; Signals Exit: Wall Street Journal
headline.main: Trump Freezes Funds for Syria; Signals Exit: Wall Street Journal

docs.snippet: The Kremlin said on Wednesday that Russia was still open to the possibility of a meeting between U.S. President Donald Trump and his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin despite Washington's expulsion of a slew of Russian diplomats.

headline.print_headline: Kremlin Says Still Open to Possible Trump-Putin Meeting
headline.main: Kremlin Says Still Open to Possible Trump-Putin Meeting
